intro: Triticum cereale, commonly known as wheat, is a major cereal grain belonging to the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its hollow, cylindrical stems and long, narrow leaves. The plant produces spikelets that bear small, two-lobed flowers, which develop into grains enclosed in protective husks. Wheat is cultivated worldwide for its high yield and nutritional value, providing essential carbohydrates and proteins. Its botanical features make it a staple in global agriculture and food production.
